HEC641F962AA846DF9442D1287458454A.text: This Act may be cited as the “United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act”.
HEC641F962AA846DF9442D1287458454A.label: 1(a)
HEC641F962AA846DF9442D1287458454A.author: olrcdev

increase.Sec. 832.Policy goals.Sec. 833.Efficiencies and streamlining.Sec. 834.Performance measures.

H85D13EB89A6944729252149C4D7AC7B1.text: The purpose of this Act is to approve and implement the Agreement between the United States of America, the United Mexican States, and Canada entered into under the authority of section 103(b) of the Bipartisan Congressional Trade Priorities and Accountability Act of 2015 (19 U.S.C. 4202(b)).
H85D13EB89A6944729252149C4D7AC7B1.author: lskouras

H1DDE260AED1A41AEA2D03FC767DEEBFB.label: tI 101
H1DDE260AED1A41AEA2D03FC767DEEBFB.publicComment: Subchapter I, Approval of, and General Provisions Relating to, the USMCA
H1DDE260AED1A41AEA2D03FC767DEEBFB.author: lskouras

H2DAB729869644F3CAB23D7147335E81A.text: If a provision of this Act provides that the implementation of an action by the President by proclamation is subject to the consultation and layover requirements of this section, that action may be proclaimed only if—
H2DAB729869644F3CAB23D7147335E81A.label: tI 104
H2DAB729869644F3CAB23D7147335E81A.author: jwagner

HFA7C6BF8BEC64F9B8AC2B2F4EA6BF90F.text: If a country (other than the United States) that has signed the USMCA does not enact implementing legislation, the Trade Representative is authorized to enter into negotiations with the other country that has signed the USMCA to consider how the applicable provisions of the USMCA can come into force with respect to the United States and that other country as promptly as possible.
HFA7C6BF8BEC64F9B8AC2B2F4EA6BF90F.label: tI 106
HFA7C6BF8BEC64F9B8AC2B2F4EA6BF90F.author: jwagner

H86F3075B6E644CE389F0AE1E3BC46890.text: Section 405(e) of the Uruguay Round Agreements Act (19 U.S.C. 3602(e)) is amended to read as follows:.

source.xml:
<title identifier="/tII" id="H0304D9142C844A45BA1D94D7BEBA2D52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
	<num value="II">Title II—</num>
	<heading>Customs provisions</heading>
	<section identifier="/tII/s201" id="H1A2609307604473492DB9D5A0EA3F2FB" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
		<num value="201">Sec. 201.</num>
		<heading> Exclusion of originating goods of USMCA countries from special agriculture safeguard authority.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/tII/s201/a" id="H86F3075B6E644CE389F0AE1E3BC46890" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
			<num value="a">(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Section 405(e) of the Uruguay Round Agreements Act (<ref href="/us/usc/19/3602">19 U.S.C. 3602(e)</ref>) is amended to read as follows:<quotedContent id="H5DD47B4E5E8643D08E6E31E4A17FEC5C" orig_name="quotedContent">
					<subsection identifier="/tII/s201/a/qB/e" id="H2C0EBC1EF5E3464CBCA3A7E5ED3D482B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
						<num value="e">“(e)</num>
						<heading> Exclusion of originating goods of USMCA countries.—</heading>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s201/a/qB/e/1" id="H466219F1792F46D78470E22A9A62D589" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
							<num value="1">“(1)</num>
							<heading> In general.—</heading>
							<content>The President shall exempt from any duty imposed under this section any good that qualifies as an originating good under section 202 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle> of a USMCA country with respect to which preferential tariff treatment is provided under the USMCA.</content>
						</paragraph>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s201/a/qB/e/2" id="H952AA82969F04018B43A41C61439A74E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
							<num value="2">“(2)</num>
							<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
							<content>In this subsection, the terms ‘preferential tariff treatment’, ‘USMCA’, and ‘USMCA country’ have the meanings given those terms in section 3 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle>.”</content>
						</paragraph>
					</subsection>
				</quotedContent>.</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</title>
source.text: Section 405(e) of the Uruguay Round Agreements Act (19 U.S.C. 3602(e)) is amended to read as follows:.

		<heading> Exclusion of originating goods of USMCA countries.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/tII/s201/a/qB/e/1" id="H466219F1792F46D78470E22A9A62D589" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>The President shall exempt from any duty imposed under this section any good that qualifies as an originating good under section 202 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle> of a USMCA country with respect to which preferential tariff treatment is provided under the USMCA.</content>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/tII/s201/a/qB/e/2" id="H952AA82969F04018B43A41C61439A74E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<content>In this subsection, the terms ‘preferential tariff treatment’, ‘USMCA’, and ‘USMCA country’ have the meanings given those terms in section 3 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle>.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

HE868E9B5F5D04DACA23FE6D5C4CF49B4.text: Section 13031(b)(10) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (19 U.S.C. 58c(b)(10)) is amended by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:.

source.xml:
<title identifier="/tII" id="H0304D9142C844A45BA1D94D7BEBA2D52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
	<num value="II">Title II—</num>
	<heading>Customs provisions</heading>
	<section identifier="/tII/s203" id="HA2EC7F6845264680A61D5EA67E329F90" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="33">
		<num value="203">Sec. 203.</num>
		<heading> Merchandise processing fee.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/tII/s203/a" id="HE868E9B5F5D04DACA23FE6D5C4CF49B4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="33">
			<num value="a">(a)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<content>Section 13031(b)(10) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (<ref href="/us/usc/19/58c">19 U.S.C. 58c(b)(10)</ref>) is amended by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:<quotedContent id="HA67A8421D52E45C18DF758983945DF45" orig_name="quotedContent">
					<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s203/a/qB/B" id="H5AA379CC15F049E3A8D4793E060D8CD4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="33">
						<num value="B">“(B)</num>
						<content> No fee may be charged under paragraph (9) or (10) of subsection (a) with respect to goods that qualify as originating goods under section 202 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle> or qualify for duty-free treatment under Annex 6–A of the USMCA (as defined in section 3 of that Act). Any service for which an exemption from such fee is provided by reason of this paragraph may not be funded with money contained in the Customs User Fee Account.”</content>
					</subparagraph>
				</quotedContent>.</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</title>
source.text: Section 13031(b)(10) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (19 U.S.C. 58c(b)(10)) is amended by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:.

execution.ampl:
strike subparagraph( "(B)"); insert <__xml__ id="HA67A8421D52E45C18DF758983945DF45" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s203/a/qB/B" id="H5AA379CC15F049E3A8D4793E060D8CD4" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="33">
		<num value="B">“(B)</num>
		<content> No fee may be charged under paragraph (9) or (10) of subsection (a) with respect to goods that qualify as originating goods under section 202 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle> or qualify for duty-free treatment under Annex 6–A of the USMCA (as defined in section 3 of that Act). Any service for which an exemption from such fee is provided by reason of this paragraph may not be funded with money contained in the Customs User Fee Account.”</content>
	</subparagraph>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 13031(b)(10) of the Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1985 (19 U.S.C. 58c(b)(10))

H910C5F86165A46678731ABD3E06DB1E7.text: Section 304 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1304) is amended by striking subsection (k) and inserting the following:.

source.xml:
<title identifier="/tII" id="H0304D9142C844A45BA1D94D7BEBA2D52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
	<num value="II">Title II—</num>
	<heading>Customs provisions</heading>
	<section identifier="/tII/s209" id="H375AA2723DDC467ABCA6960775A8031F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
		<num value="209">Sec. 209.</num>
		<heading> Other amendments to the Tariff Act of 1930.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/tII/s209/a" id="H910C5F86165A46678731ABD3E06DB1E7" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
			<num value="a">(a)</num>
			<heading> Country of origin marking.—</heading>
			<content>Section 304 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<ref href="/us/usc/19/1304">19 U.S.C. 1304</ref>) is amended by striking subsection (k) and inserting the following:<quotedContent id="H729B8C6FAC31447294B5ED29C3D7D0D7" orig_name="quotedContent">
					<subsection identifier="/tII/s209/a/qB/k" id="HF400826895DA4640880F06701DE88104" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
						<num value="k">“(k)</num>
						<heading> Treatment of goods of a USMCA country.—</heading>
						<chapeau>In applying this section to an article that qualifies as a good of a USMCA country (as defined in section 3 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle>)—</chapeau>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/a/qB/k/1" id="HEF37BF6D03F8496DA77295EE42A3713E" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
							<num value="1">“(1)</num>
							<content> the exemption under subsection (a)(3)(H) shall be applied by substituting ‘reasonably know’ for ‘necessarily know’;</content>
						</paragraph>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/a/qB/k/2" id="H4817FFC183AA4DBE93B0A66FDB507A28" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
							<num value="2">“(2)</num>
							<chapeau> the Secretary shall exempt the good from the requirements for marking under subsection (a) if the good—</chapeau>
							<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s209/a/qB/k/2/A" id="H334B33BFEC0C48C5AC03634EF4647B7C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
								<num value="A">“(A)</num>
								<content> is an original work of art; or</content>
							</subparagraph>
							<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s209/a/qB/k/2/B" id="H31479DFB8A3C42EEBA2E53F729B3EC8C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
								<num value="B">“(B)</num>
								<content> is provided for under subheading 6904.10, heading 8541, or heading 8542 of the Harmonized Tariff Schedule of the United States; and</content>
							</subparagraph>
						</paragraph>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/a/qB/k/3" id="H00BD4E8F52E14262B98F8174B5A2392C" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
							<num value="3">“(3)</num>
							<content> subsection (b) does not apply to the usual container of any good described in subsection (a)(3)(E) or (I) or paragraph (2)(A) or (B) of this subsection.”</content>
						</paragraph>
					</subsection>
				</quotedContent>.</content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</title>

H3E0422890EC4451E93A01F02A287556B.text: Section 628 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1628) is amended by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:.

source.xml:
<title identifier="/tII" id="H0304D9142C844A45BA1D94D7BEBA2D52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="9">
	<num value="II">Title II—</num>
	<heading>Customs provisions</heading>
	<section identifier="/tII/s209" id="H375AA2723DDC467ABCA6960775A8031F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
		<num value="209">Sec. 209.</num>
		<heading> Other amendments to the Tariff Act of 1930.</heading>
		<subsection identifier="/tII/s209/c" id="H3E0422890EC4451E93A01F02A287556B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
			<num value="c">(c)</num>
			<heading> Exchange of information.—</heading>
			<content>Section 628 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (<ref href="/us/usc/19/1628">19 U.S.C. 1628</ref>) is amended by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:<quotedContent id="H5B5B7300840B4C838F6B9737AAE3AC1E" orig_name="quotedContent">
					<subsection identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c" id="H201DDB5686D04A2B8F6A039AB67AC8D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
						<num value="c">“(c)</num>
						<heading> Government agency of USMCA country.—</heading>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/1" id="H07FBB2EB30EE4216B36F44C5350AE034" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
							<num value="1">“(1)</num>
							<heading> In general.—</heading>
							<chapeau>The Secretary may authorize U.S. Customs and Border Protection to exchange information with any government agency of a USMCA country, if the Secretary—</chapeau>
							<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/1/A" id="HE9C567DD3D9C48FBAA7302EBE0FAFA52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
								<num value="A">“(A)</num>
								<content> reasonably believes the exchange of information is necessary to implement chapter 2, 4, 5, 6, or 7 of the USMCA; and</content>
							</subparagraph>
							<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/1/B" id="H6818F5E7692946BD8D2ABA2A2D4C9948" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
								<num value="B">“(B)</num>
								<content> obtains assurances from such agency that the information will be held in confidence and used only for governmental purposes.</content>
							</subparagraph>
						</paragraph>
						<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/2" id="H7BBAD36DC16D4FCBA194A69758836A73" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="43">
							<num value="2">“(2)</num>
							<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
							<content>In this subsection, the terms ‘USMCA’ and ‘USMCA country’ have the meanings given those terms in section 3 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle>.”</content>
						</paragraph>
					</subsection>
				</quotedContent>. </content>
		</subsection>
	</section>
</title>
source.text: Section 628 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1628) is amended by striking subsection (c) and inserting the following:.

execution.ampl:
strike subsection( "(c)"); insert <__xml__ id="H5B5B7300840B4C838F6B9737AAE3AC1E" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c" id="H201DDB5686D04A2B8F6A039AB67AC8D6" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
		<num value="c">“(c)</num>
		<heading> Government agency of USMCA country.—</heading>
		<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/1" id="H07FBB2EB30EE4216B36F44C5350AE034" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
			<num value="1">“(1)</num>
			<heading> In general.—</heading>
			<chapeau>The Secretary may authorize U.S. Customs and Border Protection to exchange information with any government agency of a USMCA country, if the Secretary—</chapeau>
			<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/1/A" id="HE9C567DD3D9C48FBAA7302EBE0FAFA52" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
				<num value="A">“(A)</num>
				<content> reasonably believes the exchange of information is necessary to implement chapter 2, 4, 5, 6, or 7 of the USMCA; and</content>
			</subparagraph>
			<subparagraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/1/B" id="H6818F5E7692946BD8D2ABA2A2D4C9948" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="42">
				<num value="B">“(B)</num>
				<content> obtains assurances from such agency that the information will be held in confidence and used only for governmental purposes.</content>
			</subparagraph>
		</paragraph>
		<paragraph identifier="/tII/s209/c/qB/c/2" id="H7BBAD36DC16D4FCBA194A69758836A73" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="43">
			<num value="2">“(2)</num>
			<heading> Definitions.—</heading>
			<content>In this subsection, the terms ‘USMCA’ and ‘USMCA country’ have the meanings given those terms in section 3 of the <shortTitle>United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act</shortTitle>.”</content>
		</paragraph>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

cite.cite_text: Section 628 of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1628)

H3E0422890EC4451E93A01F02A287556B.label: tII 209(c)
H3E0422890EC4451E93A01F02A287556B.author: mevans

HC88C488B9BCF40A886F6B201F9AE439A.text: Notwithstanding the amendment made by subsection (c), the Secretary of the Treasury shall retain the authority provided in section 628(c) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (as in effect on the day before the date on which the USMCA enters into force) to exchange information with any government agency of a NAFTA country (as defined in section 2 of the North American Free Trade Agreement Implementation Act (as in effect on the day before the date on which the USMCA enters into force)).

H605A3DB3FA9347A1AD2123E67D561054.text: Section 202(a)(8) of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2252(a)(8)) is amended in the first sentence by striking “and title III of the United States-Panama Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act” and inserting “, title III of the United States-Panama Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act, and subtitle C of title III of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act”.

HAA6705982B0E437C99CC3E59F760E867.text: Section 13902 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the following:.

source.xml:
<title identifier="/tIII" id="HC2DD0D8611604026A2F8038EFF38551F" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="44">
	<num value="III">Title III—</num>
	<heading>Application of USMCA to sectors and services</heading>
	<subtitle identifier="/tIII/stC" id="H73D01E68344741998F1F91CA8B3E3628" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="44">
		<num value="C">Subtitle C—</num>
		<heading>United States-Mexico cross-Border long-Haul trucking services</heading>
		<section identifier="/tIII/stC/s326" id="H6EE30952F6EC476EBF051406E41BC07B" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="50">
			<num value="326">Sec. 326.</num>
			<heading> Conforming amendments.</heading>
			<subsection identifier="/tIII/stC/s326/a" id="HAA6705982B0E437C99CC3E59F760E867" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="50">
				<num value="a">(a)</num>
				<heading> Registration of motor carriers.—</heading>
				<content>Section 13902 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the following:<quotedContent id="H2C0FBBEB8425490496F147ECD4314086" orig_name="quotedContent">
						<subsection identifier="/tIII/stC/s326/a/qB/j" id="H764337464D534039BEE2BD5D8AC3F509" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="50">
							<num value="j">“(j)</num>
							<heading> Mexico-Domiciled motor carriers.—</heading>
							<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, upon an order in accordance with section 324(a) of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act, the Secretary shall carry out the relief specified by denying or imposing limitations on a request for registration or capping the number of requests for registration by Mexico-domiciled motor carriers of cargo to operate beyond the municipalities along the United States-Mexico international border and the commercial zones of those municipalities as directed.”</content>
						</subsection>
					</quotedContent>.</content>
			</subsection>
		</section>
	</subtitle>
</title>
source.text: Section 13902 of title 49, United States Code, is amended by inserting at the end the following:.

insert end <__xml__ id="H2C0FBBEB8425490496F147ECD4314086" orig_name="quotedContent">
	<subsection identifier="/tIII/stC/s326/a/qB/j" id="H764337464D534039BEE2BD5D8AC3F509" class="bill-dtd-OLC" pagenum="50">
		<num value="j">“(j)</num>
		<heading> Mexico-Domiciled motor carriers.—</heading>
		<content>Notwithstanding any other provision of this section, upon an order in accordance with section 324(a) of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement Implementation Act, the Secretary shall carry out the relief specified by denying or imposing limitations on a request for registration or capping the number of requests for registration by Mexico-domiciled motor carriers of cargo to operate beyond the municipalities along the United States-Mexico international border and the commercial zones of those municipalities as directed.”</content>
	</subsection>
</__xml__>;

H45B0EBFB62FA4E4D8F07A95860D3027C.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Trade Representative shall submit to the Committee on Finance of the Senate and the Committee on Ways and Means of the House of Representatives a report setting forth a proposal for technical and conforming amendments to the laws under the jurisdiction of such committees, and other laws, necessary to fully carry out the provisions of, and amendments made by, this Act.

H4E004FE06AFA4A168C4602963CF5DAA9.label: tVII stA 711
H4E004FE06AFA4A168C4602963CF5DAA9.author: mevans
H4E004FE06AFA4A168C4602963CF5DAA9.publicComment: Part A, Interagency Labor Committee for Monitoring and Enforcement

H9D72D3FFFE03495F8FD3B3AB59634CAD.text: The duties of the Interagency Labor Committee shall include the following:
H9D72D3FFFE03495F8FD3B3AB59634CAD.label: tVII stA 712
H9D72D3FFFE03495F8FD3B3AB59634CAD.author: mevans

HC5BBDE2DAFCF4EE5BD9C01EBDB01BA78.text: The Interagency Labor Committee shall establish a web-based hotline, monitored by the Department of Labor, to receive confidential information regarding labor issues among USMCA countries directly from interested parties, including Mexican workers.
HC5BBDE2DAFCF4EE5BD9C01EBDB01BA78.label: tVII stA 717
HC5BBDE2DAFCF4EE5BD9C01EBDB01BA78.author: mevans

HD4C4D5982FB54F91A56379AFEC291CBB.text: The duties described in this section are the following:
HD4C4D5982FB54F91A56379AFEC291CBB.label: tVII stB 722
HD4C4D5982FB54F91A56379AFEC291CBB.author: mevans

H010DBFCB9B5447D09C8A695111205554.text: Any officer or employee, while detailed or assigned under this subtitle, shall be considered, for the purpose of preserving their allowances, privileges, rights, seniority, and other benefits as such, an officer or employee of the United States Government and of the agency of the United States Government from which detailed or assigned, and shall continue to receive compensation, allowances, and benefits from program funds appropriated to that agency or made available to that agency for purposes related to the activities of the detail or assignment, in accordance with authorities related to their employment status and agency policies.
H010DBFCB9B5447D09C8A695111205554.label: tVII stB 723
H010DBFCB9B5447D09C8A695111205554.author: mevans

HD8904C6715B244FD9484DDC29F7F2F81.text: There is hereby established a board, to be known as the “Independent Mexico Labor Expert Board”, to be responsible for monitoring and evaluating the implementation of Mexico’s labor reform and compliance with its labor obligations. The Board shall also advise the Interagency Labor Committee with respect to capacity-building activities needed to support such implementation and compliance.
HD8904C6715B244FD9484DDC29F7F2F81.label: tVII stC 731
HD8904C6715B244FD9484DDC29F7F2F81.author: mevans
HD8904C6715B244FD9484DDC29F7F2F81.publicComment: Part C, Independent Mexico Labor Export Board

H0D2300EB6FD144A8BB754AB57B9FCB86.text: The United States shall provide necessary funding to support the work of the Board, including with respect to translation services and personnel support.
H0D2300EB6FD144A8BB754AB57B9FCB86.label: tVII stC 733
H0D2300EB6FD144A8BB754AB57B9FCB86.author: mevans

H2530CDF151DA48079985AD5AEFEFDC62.text: For the 6-year period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, and for an additional 4 years if the term of the Board is extended in accordance with section 732(c), the Board shall submit to appropriate congressional committees and to the Interagency Labor Committee an annual report that—
H2530CDF151DA48079985AD5AEFEFDC62.label: tVII stC 734
H2530CDF151DA48079985AD5AEFEFDC62.author: mevans

HDBC2FE7DEA894032A0BACA74B640E1B0.text: The Forced Labor Enforcement Task Force shall submit to appropriate congressional committees a biannual report that includes the following:
HDBC2FE7DEA894032A0BACA74B640E1B0.label: tVII stD 743
HDBC2FE7DEA894032A0BACA74B640E1B0.author: mevans

HB41217B68A9D4F4B99FFC123AD429F6B.text: Each report issued by a rapid response labor panel constituted in accordance with Annex 31–A of the USMCA shall be immediately submitted to the appropriate congressional committees, the Labor Advisory Committee established under section 135(c)(1) of the Trade Act of 1974 (19 U.S.C. 2155(c)(1)) (or successor advisory committee), and, as appropriate, the petitioner submitting information pursuant to section 716. The Trade Representative shall also make each such report publicly available in a timely manner.
HB41217B68A9D4F4B99FFC123AD429F6B.label: tVII stE 751
HB41217B68A9D4F4B99FFC123AD429F6B.author: mevans
HB41217B68A9D4F4B99FFC123AD429F6B.publicComment: Part E, Enforcement Under Rapid Response Labor Mechanism

H5DB8A2DF02304CFAA6635C75F848DF30.label: tVIII 801
H5DB8A2DF02304CFAA6635C75F848DF30.author: mevans
H5DB8A2DF02304CFAA6635C75F848DF30.publicComment: Subchapter VII, Environment Monitoring and Enforcement

HBBB85327A620456D8810529D1B297200.label: tVIII stA 811
HBBB85327A620456D8810529D1B297200.author: mevans
HBBB85327A620456D8810529D1B297200.publicComment: Part A, Interagency Environment Committee for Monitoring and Enforcement

HC1759A1373E344E6ACFE251634FAC5F0.text: The head of any Federal agency described in this subtitle, in consultation with the Interagency Environment Committee, may prescribe such regulations as are necessary to carry out the authorities of the Federal agency as provided for under this subtitle.
HC1759A1373E344E6ACFE251634FAC5F0.label: tVIII stA 817
HC1759A1373E344E6ACFE251634FAC5F0.author: mevans

H1ED00BB2E0334751BDA098D871F7645A.label: tVIII stC 831 "547"
H1ED00BB2E0334751BDA098D871F7645A.author: mevans
H1ED00BB2E0334751BDA098D871F7645A.privateComment: Act is repealed by section 601 on date USMCA goes into effect.

H778815E3997D4401BBD8C18EFB43806B.text: The Secretary of the Treasury should direct the representatives of the United States to the Board of Directors of the North American Development Bank to use the voice and vote of the United States to seek to require the Bank to develop and implement efficiency improvements to streamline and accelerate the project certification and financing process, including through initiatives such as single certifications for revolving facilities, programmatic certification of similar groups of small projects, expansion of internal authority to approve qualified projects below certain monetary thresholds, and expedited certification for public sector projects subject to lender bidding processes.
H778815E3997D4401BBD8C18EFB43806B.label: tVIII stC 833
H778815E3997D4401BBD8C18EFB43806B.author: mevans
